p: The N 2 adsorption/desorption test was used to explore the surface area and pore structures of Co@CNTs-800. As shown in Figure 4a, the Brunner–Emmet–Teller specific surface area was revealed to be 52.7 m 2 g −1. The N 2 adsorption/desorption curve exhibited a characteristic type IV isotherm and a distinct hysteresis loop at relative high pressure, demonstrating their mesoporous structure. The pore size distribution curve in Figure 4b was used to confirm the mesoporous feature. The pore diameters located at 4.0, 7.6, 10.7, and 28.9 nm indicated the presence of mesopore, beneficial to the rapid mass transfer process.
